title: Missing documentation folder in armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf installer (both standalone and using rustup)

labels.name: O-Arm
labels.description: Target: 32-bit Arm processors (armv6, armv7, thumb...), including 64-bit Arm in AArch32 state

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

labels.name: T-infra
labels.description: Relevant to the infrastructure team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Tried in Linux raspberrypi 4.4.9-v7 Friday, May 6 2016, armv7l GNU/Linux.  All the steps described below were executed in 23th or July, 2019.

While following the installation guide (ref001, at the bottom of this report), and once Rust is sucessfully installed in the system (stable version, 1.36.0; compiling with rustc works, etc), the following command fails:
`rustup doc`

A quick look at <home_dir>/.rustup/toolchains/stable-armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf/share/doc shows that the "/html" folder does not exist (with the index.html file and all the documentation)

Here is the output of executing the "tree" utility in <home_dir>/.rustup/toolchains/stable-armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf/share/doc. No html folder is present in neither of the components (also, a "find" command does find any index, just in case)

_+-- cargo
¦   +-- LICENSE-APACHE
¦   +-- LICENSE-MIT
¦   +-- LICENSE-THIRD-PARTY
¦   +-- README.md
+-- clippy
¦   +-- LICENSE-APACHE
¦   +-- LICENSE-MIT
¦   +-- README.md
+-- rust
¦   +-- COPYRIGHT
¦   +-- LICENSE-APACHE
¦   +-- LICENSE-MIT
¦   +-- README.md
+-- rustfmt
    +-- LICENSE-APACHE
    +-- LICENSE-MIT
    +-- README.md_


Removing the toolchain and reinstalling again does not fix the error. Neither adding the documentation manually with the following comand:
`rustup component add rust-docs`

The previous command returns the following error:

_toolchain 'stable-armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf' does not contain component 'rust-docs' for target 'stable-armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf'_

The standalone install for this very same architecture (ref002) also lacks the /html folder.

This lack of documentation does not happen in other installations (i.e, x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu works well both with rustup and standallone)

Does not know if this lack of documentation in the specified installation is intended or is a bug.
**Could this happen in other installations too?**

### REFERENCES
ref001:
    https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/ch01-01-installation.html

ref002:
    https://forge.rust-lang.org/other-installation-methods.html#standalone
